Key Match Events: Msakini Youssef scored the only goal of the match from the penalty spot in the 87th minute
Brighton Munthali kept the Flames in the match after he denied Khenisi Yassine
Chifundo Mphasi caused problems to the visitors
Post-Match Reflections: Patrick Mabedi said there were several positives that could be drawn from the match
John Banda was disappointed with the loss
Tunisia Coach Jalel Kadri said they deserved the win
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Flames were hoping for back-to-back victory in the World Cup qualifiers
The result means the Flames are still third in Group H with three points from two matches
Sports bodies hope for a better 2025
Others: The Flames had a grand game in the first half as they exchanged passes and created chances which were not utilised
Attacker Wisdom Mpinganjira, on his first start for the Flames, had a grand game and caused plenty of problems for Tunisia defenders
